5.7.19  10:00 am   I think its terrifying that you keep track of your progress to the extent you do. If i did it i think i will be guilty over the days i don't do much work or the days i don't do work at all.

      Its also scary sharing the progress with other people because im scared they'll judge me the same way and compare me to others who improve more in less time

5.6.19  1:00 pm   so. during reality editing, since you've confirmed you don't watch the entire unedited videos,

      how do you go about finding the moments you end up actually putting into the final edited vids?

      if i were doing that kind of thing (and have as long of videos as you, considering if i'm remembering correctly that you have reality videos that can be hours long), i'd kind of skip around the videos trying to find what is good enough to go into the final versions. if that makes sense.

5.6.19  11:40 am   how did you create the "talking" effect in a Play featuring an iphone power block and a mechanical pencil? i'd assume you took pictures of both the pencil and the power block in one position and both in the other position and then edited it to make it so when one is "talking" the other doesn't move whatsoever. i hope that makes sense

5.6.19  2:57 am   Can you give me the opening chord to I Can Play?

      I'll take it from there. Since you don't jack on to your own work, that's one of your earliest songs IIRC. Since you don't go keychange crazy

      like The Road I can even integrate the bassline/incidentals easily probably.

The Road is also super fun to play/sing to. A true vocal exercise with just the right amount of the crazychords
